title.narrative: Protecting 325 Older persons at Risk with Shelter interventions in Akkar in Mhammara, Bebnine, Berqayel, and Halba municipalities and T5 in Ghoraba, Jabal Mohsein, Tabbaneh, Abou Samra and Jabal Beddawi

description.narrative:
LebRelief and Concern Worldwide will support 325 older persons at risk living in T5 and Akkar, in accessing safe, secure and adapted shelters for increased autonomy and dignity. The target group will be vulnerable Syrian refugees and poor host community members, including Lebanese, Palestine Refugees from Syria and Palestine Refugees in Lebanon and will benefit from the following activities: - upgrade of 105 substandard residential buildings so as to reduce immediate protection-related shelter needs for older people(105 sub res x 1.1 right holder = 116 individuals) - upgrade of 154 minor repairs of non-residential buildings to minimum standards so as to reduce immediate protection-related shelter needs for older people (154 non res x 1.1 right holder = 169 individuals) - upgrade of 8 common area within substandard collective shelters so to contribute to enhanced well-being and protection space of the residents, as well as stability of disadvantaged area(8 CA X 5 ind= 40 ind) To total up to 325 right holder
LebRelief will be using already trained marginalized youth in each area of intervention and will train additional youth on construction and rehabilitation through Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET), so to improve their skills and increase their employability, while rehabilitating the shelters at an affordable cost.
Concern will provide training and guidance to LebRelief regarding intervening in Collective Shelters particularly in the upgrading of common areas and in the creation of Resident’s Building Committees. This will build the capacity of this national NGO to increase their interventions in disadvantaged areas. In parallel, LebRelief and Concern will provide information and awareness raising sessions for beneficiaries and other residents regarding the services available in the area so to increase the knowledge on existing services and decrease isolation. Some sessions on Housing, Land and Property rights (HLP) will also be provided to beneficiaries and landlords, so as to secure their tenure and protect further their rights. Referrals will also be conducted by LebRelief and Concern for people in need of additional support.
